<br>

The [Alerts of Alerts app](https://github.com/CDCgov/Rnssp-shiny-apps/tree/master/alerts_of_alerts) from the CDC's [Rnssp-shiny-apps](https://github.com/CDCgov/Rnssp-shiny-apps) repository computes and tests for temporal alerts in 3 statewide diagnostics of syndrome severity given a user-selected state, CC and DD category, and date range. The 3 diagnostics are: 

  1. the total statewide percent of ED visits, 
  2. the number of alerting counties/regions, and 
  3. the number of counties/regions estimated to have increasing case counts. 

The second two diagnostics have been coined `Alerts of Alerts`. Data associated to a selected date are visualized as a set of choropleth maps along with the results of statistical tests for spatial autocorrelation (i.e., spatial clustering).

<br>
<br>

```{r leafletout, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
params$inc_progress(msg = "Adding Choropleth Maps...", amnt = 0.25)
A <- params$leaflet_object_p
B <- params$leaflet_object_alerts
C <- params$leaflet_object_increasing

div(class = 'sync-container-wrapper',
  div(class = 'sync-container',
    sync(tagList(A, B, C), ncol=3)
  )
)
params$inc_progress(msg = "Completing render...", amnt = 0.25)
```

<br>
<br>

### Alerts of alerts spatial autocorrelation diagnostics

  a. This map shows the spatial distribution of p-values corresponding to each respective region's test for temporal alerts. This spatial distribution of p-values is tested for spatial auto-correlation (i.e., clustering) using Global Moran's $I$ ($p=$ `r params$globalMoran`). Moran's $I$ operates on continuous data; small p-values for the Global Moran's $I$ test indicate that both regions with low temporal p-values and regions with high temporal p-values are spatially clustered, respectively.
  b. This map shows the spatial distribution of Alerts computed via the <a href="https://cdcgov.github.io/Rnssp/reference/alert_switch.html" target="_blank"> Rnssp Switch (Adaptive Regression/EWMA)</a> algorithm. This spatial distribution of warnings and alerts is tested for spatial auto-correlation using <a href="https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/spdep/versions/1.2-8/topics/joincount.test" target="_blank"> Join Count</a> statistical tests. One test tests whether Alerts (red) are spatially clustered ($p=$ `r params$joincount_alert`), while a second test tests whether both Alerts and Warnings (red and yellow), treated as a single grouping, are spatially clustered ($p=$ `r params$joincount_warningoralert`).
  c. This map shows the spatial distribution of Alerts computed via slope thresholds. This configuration of slope-threshold-based Alerts is tested for spatial auto-correlation using a Join Count test ($p=$ `r params$joincount_inc`).
